triples.name: Feature Selection
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a new heterogeneous feature selection method based on neighborhood combination entropy.

triples.name: Rough Set
triples.relevance: Neighborhood rough set theory is used as the foundational framework for handling heterogeneous data in feature selection.

triples.name: Dimensionality Reduction
triples.relevance: The paper addresses dimensionality curse through feature selection, a key application of dimensionality reduction techniques.

triples.name: Entropy (Information Theory)
triples.relevance: The paper proposes neighborhood combination entropy (NCE) and conditional neighborhood combination entropy (cNCE) as new entropy-based measures.

triples.name: Statistical Classification
triples.relevance: Feature selection is used to enhance learning performance in classification tasks by removing irrelevant or redundant features.
